ko: 사람들이 걔 주변으로 몰려들고 있었어.

en: His income is larger than that of his wife.
ko: 걔가 자기 부인보다 더 많이 벌어.

en: His income was diminished by half after retirement.
ko: 은퇴하고 나서 수입이 반으로 줄었대.

en: He has a considerable income.
ko: 걔 수입이 꽤 짭짤해.

en: His income is too small to support his family.
ko: 걔 수입으로는 식구들 먹여 살리기 힘들어.

en: His income bears no proportion to his social standing.
ko: 걔 사회적 지위에 비해서 수입이 너무 적어.

en: His income is three times larger than mine.
ko: 걔가 나보다 세 배는 더 벌어.

en: The majority of his income goes to pay his rent.
ko: 걔 수입 대부분이 월세로 나가.

en: He's coy about his income.
ko: 걔 자기 수입에 대해서는 말을 아껴.

en: Finding it hard to make ends meet on his income, she started to work.
ko: 걔 수입만으로는 생활이 안 돼서 그 여자분도 일을 시작했어.

en: With his income, he cannot afford the costly dinners.
ko: 걔 벌이로는 그런 비싼 저녁 못 먹어.

en: His sands are running out.
ko: 걔 살날이 얼마 안 남았어.

en: His terrible suffering aroused her pity.
ko: 걔가 너무 고생하는 걸 보고 그 여자가 안쓰러워했어.

en: His resignation as Prime Minister came as a surprise.
ko: 걔가 총리직에서 물러난 건 정말 갑작스러웠어.

en: His hobby is going fishing on Sundays.
ko: 걔 취미는 일요일마다 낚시 가는 거야.

en: His hobby is collecting strange butterflies.
ko: 걔 취미는 희귀한 나비 수집하는 거야.

en: His hobby is collecting old stamps.
ko: 걔 취미는 옛날 우표 모으는 거야.

en: His hobby is painting pictures.
ko: 걔 취미는 그림 그리는 거야.

en: His hobby is painting pictures of flowers.
ko: 걔 취미는 꽃 그림 그리는 거야.

en: His hobbies are playing the guitar and singing.
ko: 걔 취미는 기타 치면서 노래 부르는 거야.

en: His hobby is collecting stamps.
ko: 걔 취미는 우표 수집이야.

en: His hobby is stamp collecting.
ko: 걔 취미는 우표 모으는 거야.

en: His technique was absolutely amazing.
ko: 걔 기술이 진짜 대단했어.

en: Thanks to him giving me a hand, I was able to finish the work.
ko: 걔가 도와준 덕분에 일을 끝낼 수 있었어.

en: Thanks to his help, I finished my homework.
ko: 걔 도움으로 숙제 다 끝냈어.

en: His letter was so confused that I could hardly make any sense of it at all.
ko: 걔 편지가 너무 엉망이라 도통 무슨 말인지 모르겠더라.

en: His letter made her angry.
ko: 걔 편지 때문에 그 여자가 화났어.

en: His letter doesn't make any sense.
ko: 걔 편지 도통 뭔 소린지 모르겠어.

en: His letter alludes to the event.
ko: 걔 편지에 그 사건에 대한 얘기가 슬쩍 비쳐.

en: His letter indirectly refers to the matter.
ko: 걔 편지가 그 일을 돌려서 말하고 있어.

en: You must answer his letter, and that at once.
ko: 걔 편지에 답장 꼭 해줘, 그것도 지금 바로.

en: You should have replied to his letter.
ko: 그 사람 편지에 답장했어야지.

en: Remember to answer his letter.
ko: 그 사람 편지에 답장하는 거 잊지 마.

en: Don't forget to answer his letter.
ko: 그 사람 편지에 답장하는 거 깜빡하지 마.

en: Should I reply to his letter?
ko: 그 사람 편지에 답장해야 할까?

en: I wonder if I should answer his letter.
ko: 그 사람 편지에 답장해야 되나 고민되네.

en: I have to answer his letter.
ko: 그 사람 편지에 답장해야 돼.

en: His letter says he'll arrive next Sunday.
ko: 그 사람 편지에 다음 주 일요일에 도착한다고 써 있어.

en: His letter enclosed a picture.
ko: 그 사람 편지에 사진도 들어있더라.

en: What does he say in his letter?
ko: 그 사람 편지에 뭐라고 써 있어?

en: His letter hurt Jane's vanity.
ko: 그 사람 편지가 제인의 자존심을 상하게 했어.

en: So passionate was his letter that she was moved to tears.
ko: 편지가 너무 절절해서 걔가 눈물을 흘릴 정도였어.

en: To her disappointment, his letter didn't come.
ko: 실망스럽게도 그 사람 편지는 오지 않았어.

en: His hands were covered with mud.
ko: 걔 손이 진흙투성이였어.

en: His hands feel rough.
ko: 걔 손이 거칠거칠해.

en: His hands were blue because of the cold.
ko: 추워서 걔 손이 파랗게 질렸어.

en: His hands turned blue because it was so cold.
ko: 너무 추워서 걔 손이 파랗게 변했어.

en: His hands had turned blue because of the cold.
ko: 추워서 걔 손이 파랗게 질려 있었어.

en: His hands were blue with cold.
ko: 추워서 걔 손이 파랬어.

en: Place a coin in the palm of his hand.
ko: 걔 손바닥에 동전 하나 올려놔 봐.

en: At best he'll get 1,000 votes.
ko: 걔가 얻어봤자 기껏해야 천 표일 거야.

en: His claim is really the same as the one Benson proposed in Entrepreneurs.
ko: 걔 주장은 '엔터프리너스'에서 벤슨이 제안한 거랑 똑같아.

en: His claim is that there is a close relation between birth order and personality.
ko: 걔 주장은 태어난 순서랑 성격 사이에 밀접한 관계가 있다는 거야.

en: His argument is that women should not smoke or drink.
ko: 걔 주장은 여자는 술 담배를 하면 안 된다는 거야.

en: It is important to note that his assertion is groundless.
ko: 걔 주장이 근거 없다는 점을 꼭 알아야 돼.

en: His doctors told him that he would see, hear, and taste as before.
ko: 의사들이 걔한테 예전처럼 보고 듣고 맛볼 수 있을 거래.

en: His doctor came with all speed.
ko: 걔 의사가 엄청 빨리 달려왔어.

en: His main interest is in history.
ko: 걔 주된 관심사는 역사야.

en: His weakness cancels out his virtues.
ko: 걔 단점이 장점을 다 깎아먹어.

en: Stop taking advantage of his weakness.
ko: 걔 약점 좀 그만 이용해.

en: We should take his youth into account.
ko: 걔가 어리다는 걸 감안해줘야 돼.

en: We must consider his youth.
ko: 걔 나이가 어린 걸 고려해야 해.

en: In light of his youth the police have decided not to charge him.
ko: 걔가 어려서 경찰도 기소하지 않기로 했대.

en: His debts amount to a considerable sum.
ko: 걔 빚이 꽤 상당해.

en: His debts amount to $2,000.
ko: 걔 빚이 2,000달러나 돼.

en: His debts amount to 100,000 yen.
ko: 걔 빚이 10만 엔이나 돼.

en: His debts amount to over $1000.
ko: 걔 빚이 1,000달러가 넘어.

en: His debts amount to over $1,000.
ko: 걔 빚이 1,000달러가 넘게 있어.

en: His debts amounted to five million yen.
ko: 걔 빚이 500만 엔이나 됐었어.

en: His debt amounted to a considerable sum.
ko: 걔 빚이 꽤 큰 액수였어.

en: His debts amount to two million dollars.
ko: 걔 빚이 200만 달러나 돼.

en: His debts amounted to a thousand dollars.
ko: 걔 빚이 1,000달러 정도 됐었어.

en: His debt came to 100 dollars.
ko: 걔 빚이 100달러였어.

en: We disturbed him.
ko: 우리가 걔를 방해했어.

en: His car is really cool.
ko: 걔 차 진짜 멋있어.

en: His car was blue; hers was red.
ko: 걔 차는 파란색이었고 그 여자 차는 빨간색이었어.

en: His car was blue. Her car was red.
ko: 걔 차는 파란색이었어. 그 여자 차는 빨간색이었고.

en: His car was blue and hers was red.
ko: 걔 차는 파란색이고 그 여자 차는 빨간색이야.

en: His car looks as good as new.
ko: 걔 차 완전 새 차 같아.

en: His car is small and takes up little room.
ko: 걔 차는 작아서 자리를 별로 안 차지해.

en: His car has just been repaired.
ko: 걔 차 방금 수리 끝났어.

en: His car is similar to mine.
ko: 걔 차 내 거랑 비슷해.

en: His car fell into the lake.
ko: 걔 차 호수에 빠졌어.

en: His car is a new model.
ko: 걔 차 신형이야.

en: His car broke down on the way to work.
ko: 걔 차 출근하는 길에 고장 났어.

en: His car is a Ford.
ko: 걔 차 포드야.

en: His car was seriously damaged.
ko: 걔 차 심하게 망가졌어.

en: His car shaved the wall of the tunnel.
ko: 걔 차 터널 벽 긁었어.

en: His car ran into the Iron Gate.
ko: 걔 차가 철문에 들이받았어.

en: His car soon went out of sight.
ko: 걔 차 금방 안 보이게 됐어.

en: His car got no more than fourteen miles.
ko: 걔 차 14마일밖에 못 갔어.

en: His car remained locked.
ko: 걔 차 계속 잠겨 있었어.

en: His car turned over several times before falling into the river.
ko: 걔 차가 몇 번 구르더니 강에 빠졌어.

en: His car is in fact worn out.
ko: 걔 차 사실 거의 다 낡았어.

en: His car has no wheels.
ko: 걔 차 바퀴가 없어.

en: His car is gaining on us.
ko: 걔 차가 우리 따라잡고 있어.

en: His picture was in the newspaper.
ko: 걔 사진 신문에 났어.

en: I was vexed at his irresolute attitude.
ko: 걔의 우유부단한 태도 때문에 짜증 났어.

en: His play was a hit.
ko: 걔 연극 대박 났어.

en: His play ended in large success.
ko: 걔 연극 성공적으로 끝났어.

en: The result of his experiment corresponded with mine.
ko: 걔 실험 결과가 내 거랑 똑같았어.

en: His experiments came to a standstill.
ko: 걔 실험이 중단됐어.

en: His experiment had many faults in its details.
ko: 걔 실험은 세부적인 부분에서 문제가 많았어.

en: I gave him the best answer in English to his question that I could.
ko: 걔 질문에 내가 할 수 있는 한 최대로 영어 답변을 해줬어.

en: His jealousy began to raise its head again.
ko: 걔 질투심이 다시 고개를 들기 시작했어.

en: I was very confused by his questions.
ko: 걔 질문들 때문에 너무 혼란스러웠어.

en: I was terribly confused by his question.
ko: 걔 질문 때문에 진짜 당황했어.

en: I was awfully confused by his question.
ko: 걔 질문 때문에 엄청 헷갈렸어.

en: How do you account for his failure?
ko: 걔 실패를 어떻게 설명할 거야?

en: Is his failure ascribable to incompetence or to bad luck?
ko: 걔 실패가 무능해서 그런 거야, 아니면 운이 없어서 그런 거야?

en: His failure is due to his ignorance.
ko: 걔 실패는 무지함 때문이야.

en: His failure resulted from his carelessness.
ko: 걔 실패는 부주의해서 생긴 일이야.

en: His failure was mainly due to carelessness.
ko: 걔 실패는 주로 부주의 때문이었어.

en: His failure led to his resignation.
ko: 걔 실패가 결국 사임으로 이어졌어.

en: His failure has nothing to do with me.
ko: 걔 실패는 나랑 상관없는 일이야.

en: His failure taught me a good lesson.
ko: 걔 실패가 나한테 좋은 교훈이 됐어.

en: His failure was the last thing that I expected.
ko: 걔가 실패할 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어.

en: His failure is out of the question.
ko: 걔가 실패할 리가 없어.

en: His failure is, in a manner, our failure too.
ko: 걔 실패는 어떤 면에서 우리 실패이기도 해.

en: The immediate cause of his failure was lack of study.
ko: 걔 실패의 직접적인 원인은 공부 부족이었어.

en: The primary cause of his failure is laziness.
ko: 걔 실패의 주된 원인은 게으름이야.

en: His failure is not to be ascribed to want of diligence.
ko: 걔 실패가 성실함이 부족해서 그런 건 아니야.

en: There seem to be several reasons for his failure.
ko: 걔 실패에는 몇 가지 이유가 있는 것 같아.

en: His resignation left a vacancy in the cabinet.
ko: 걔가 사임하면서 내각에 빈자리가 생겼어.

en: I am sick to death of his boasts.
ko: 걔 자랑질 진짜 지긋지긋해.

en: I'm tired of listening to his boasts.
ko: 걔 자랑 들어주는 거 이제 질렸어.

en: His bicycle is blue.
ko: 걔 자전거 파란색이야.

en: His bicycle is different from this one.
ko: 걔 자전거는 이거랑 달라.

en: His autobiography was released today and was sold out by noon.
ko: 걔 자서전이 오늘 나왔는데 낮에 이미 다 팔렸어.

en: His suicide came as a result of his disappointment in love.
ko: 걔 실연 때문에 자살했어.

en: His ear trouble made hearing very difficult.
ko: 걔 귀에 문제가 있어서 잘 안 들려.

en: The political situation was, to say the least, extremely unstable during the next ten years of his reign.
ko: 그의 재위 기간 중 다음 10년 동안의 정치 상황은 말할 것도 없이 정말 불안정했어요.

en: His next production was a very ambitious musical.
ko: 그의 다음 작품은 정말 야심 찬 뮤지컬이었어요.

en: But for his timely rescue, I would have drowned.
ko: 그가 제때 구해주지 않았더라면 전 익사했을 거예요.

en: His untimely statement has not only let the cat out of the bag but also upset the apple cart for the peace move.
ko: 그의 시기부적절한 발언 때문에 비밀이 탄로 났을 뿐만 아니라 평화 협상도 다 망쳐버렸어요.

en: Some of the books that he has are English novels.
ko: 그가 가진 책 중 몇 권은 영어 소설이에요.

en: His writing is impossible to read.
ko: 그 사람 글씨는 도저히 못 알아보겠어요.

en: His office is located in the center of the town.
ko: 그 사람 사무실은 시내 중심가에 있어요.

en: His office is going to be shut down for want of money.
ko: 돈이 없어서 그 사람 사무실이 문을 닫게 생겼어요.

en: His office is past the bank on your left.
ko: 그 사람 사무실은 왼쪽 은행을 지나면 있어요.

en: His office is convenient to the station.
ko: 그 사람 사무실은 역이랑 가까워서 편해요.

en: His office is convenient for the station.
ko: 그 사람 사무실은 역에서 가기 편한 곳에 있어요.

en: His office is on the eighth floor.
ko: 그 사람 사무실은 8층에 있어요.

en: The furniture in his office is very modern.
ko: 사무실 가구가 아주 세련됐더라고요.

en: His office is right up there.
ko: 그 사람 사무실은 바로 저기 위에 있어요.

en: His business has begun to thrive at last.
ko: 드디어 그 사람 사업이 잘되기 시작했어요.

en: His business was only a partial success.
ko: 그 사람 사업은 절반의 성공에 그쳤어요.

en: I hear his business is on the verge of ruin.
ko: 그 사람 사업이 망하기 직전이라고 들었어요.

en: I hear his business is on the verge of going bankrupt.
ko: 그 사람 사업이 파산하기 일보 직전이라고 하더라고요.

en: His business is growing rapidly.
ko: 그 사람 사업이 아주 빠르게 성장하고 있어요.

en: I don't like his boasting of his success in business.
ko: 그 사람이 자기 사업 성공했다고 자랑하는 거 정말 보기 싫어요.

en: To do him justice, he is not a selfish man.
ko: 공정하게 말해서, 그는 이기적인 사람은 아니에요.

en: I know him only by name.
ko: 이름만 들어봤고 잘은 몰라요.

en: Forget him.
ko: 그 사람은 잊어버려요.

en: His teeth are yellow from smoking too much.
ko: 담배를 너무 많이 피워서 그 사람 이가 노래졌어요.

en: When do you think his funds will run out?
ko: 그 사람 자금이 언제쯤 바닥날까요?

en: We must take his illness into consideration before marking his exam.
ko: 시험 점수를 매기기 전에 그가 아팠던 걸 고려해야 해요.

en: His poems are difficult to understand.
ko: 그 사람 시는 이해하기가 좀 어려워요.

en: His poetry does not translate into Japanese.
ko: 그 사람 시는 일본어로 번역이 안 돼요.

en: His poem reads as follows.
ko: 그의 시는 다음과 같은 내용이에요.

en: His eyesight is failing.
ko: 그분 시력이 점점 나빠지고 있어요.

en: We cannot touch on his private affairs.
ko: 그 사람 사생활에 대해서는 언급할 수 없어요.

en: The way he looked at me irritated me very much.
ko: 그 사람이 나를 쳐다보는 눈빛이 정말 짜증 났어요.

en: His passion for me doesn't cool.
ko: 나를 향한 그 사람의 열정은 식을 줄을 몰라요.

en: An announcement of his death appeared in the newspapers.
ko: 신문에 그 사람의 부고 소식이 실렸어요.

en: Ten years have gone by since his death.
ko: 그가 죽은 지 벌써 10년이 지났어요.

en: After he died, my life was turned upside down.
ko: 그가 죽고 나서 제 인생이 완전히 뒤바뀌었어요.

en: The cause of his death still remains a mystery.
ko: 그의 사인은 아직도 미스터리로 남아 있어요.

en: I was deeply affected when I heard of his death.
ko: 그의 죽음 소식을 듣고 정말 큰 충격을 받았어요.

ko: 그 사람 연구 방법론이 우리 연구에도 도움이 많이 돼.

en: His dog was named Popeye by him.
ko: 걔가 자기 강아지 이름을 뽀빠이라고 지었어.

en: His dog was running in the yard.
ko: 그 집 강아지가 마당에서 뛰놀고 있었어.

en: His dog is hard of hearing.
ko: 그 집 강아지는 귀가 잘 안 들려.

en: His dog barks at me.
ko: 그 집 개가 나만 보면 짖어.

en: His dog follows him wherever he goes.
ko: 그 집 강아지는 걔가 어딜 가든 졸졸 따라다녀.

en: He painted a picture of a dog.
ko: 걔가 강아지 그림을 그렸어.

en: His dog appeared from behind the door.
ko: 문 뒤에서 걔네 강아지가 나타났어.

en: His greed for power knows no bounds.
ko: 그 사람 권력욕은 끝이 없어.

en: His persistent efforts resulted in failure.
ko: 그렇게 애를 썼는데도 결국 실패로 끝났어.

en: His hard work bore fruit.
ko: 노력한 게 드디어 결실을 맺었어.

en: He is in a poor state of health.
ko: 그 사람 건강 상태가 별로 안 좋아.

en: His health is improving little by little.
ko: 그 사람 건강이 조금씩 나아지고 있어.

en: His health is changing for the better.
ko: 그 사람 건강이 좋아지고 있어.

en: He is improving in health.
ko: 그 사람 몸이 점점 좋아지고 있어.

en: His health has begun to decline now.
ko: 그 사람 건강이 이제 나빠지기 시작했어.

en: I am anxious about his health.
ko: 그 사람 건강이 걱정돼.

en: I am concerned about his health.
ko: 그 사람 건강이 염려되네.

en: He cannot support his family on his monthly income.
ko: 그 월급으로는 가족들 부양하기가 힘들어.

en: His monthly income amounts to half a million yen.
ko: 그 사람 월급이 50만 엔 정도 된대.

en: His solution turned out to be a complete mistake.
ko: 그 사람이 내놓은 해결책이 완전히 틀린 거였어.

en: His conclusion is based on these facts.
ko: 그 사람 결론은 이런 사실들에 근거한 거야.

en: I was disillusioned at his married life.
ko: 그 사람 결혼 생활 보고 환상이 다 깨졌어.

en: These dirty clothes could be a new piece of evidence to prove his innocence.
ko: 이 더러운 옷들이 그 사람 무죄를 밝혀낼 새로운 증거가 될 수도 있어.

en: She looked on his decision as a grave mistake.
ko: 걔는 그 사람 결정이 큰 실수라고 생각했어.

en: He was quite decided in his determination.
ko: 그 사람 결심이 아주 확고했어.

en: Because of his determination, he was able to tide over the crisis.
ko: 그 사람의 굳은 의지 덕분에 위기를 넘길 수 있었어.

en: People liked him all the better for his faults.
ko: 사람들은 오히려 그 사람의 단점 때문에 그를 더 좋아했어.

en: I love him none the less for his faults.
ko: 단점이 좀 있긴 하지만 그래도 난 그 사람이 좋아.

en: For all his faults, Sam is still a very likable person.
ko: 샘은 단점이 많은데도 참 호감 가는 사람이야.

en: His absence gave birth to all sorts of rumors.
ko: 그 사람이 없으니까 온갖 소문이 다 나더라고.

en: His being absent complicates matters.
ko: 그 사람이 자리를 비워서 일이 좀 복잡해졌어.

en: His masterpiece has not appeared yet.
ko: 그 사람 걸작은 아직 안 나왔어.

en: His talent is green.
ko: 그 사람 실력은 아직 풋내기 수준이야.

en: I am quite ignorant of his plan.
ko: 난 그 사람 계획에 대해서 전혀 몰라.

en: His plan seemed to be too difficult, but before long it proved to be feasible.
ko: 그 사람 계획이 너무 어려워 보였는데, 얼마 안 가서 실현 가능하다는 게 증명됐어.

en: His plan ought not to be abandoned.
ko: 그 사람 계획을 포기하면 안 돼.

en: His plan was discarded.
ko: 그 사람 계획은 무산됐어.

en: His plan sounds impracticable.
ko: 그 사람 계획은 현실성이 없어 보여.

en: His plan struck them as impractical.
ko: 사람들은 그 사람 계획이 비현실적이라고 느꼈어.

en: His project ended in failure.
ko: 그 사람 프로젝트는 결국 실패로 끝났어.

en: His undertaking failed for lack of funds.
ko: 자금이 부족해서 그 사람 사업이 실패했어.

en: His scheme went wrong in the end.
ko: 그 사람 계획이 결국 틀어져 버렸어.

en: I see a great danger in his plan.
ko: 그 사람 계획은 너무 위험해 보여.

en: His plan is dangerous!
ko: 그 사람 계획은 위험해!

en: His plan is still in the air.
ko: 걔 계획 아직 확실하지 않아.

en: His plan leaves much to be desired.
ko: 걔 계획은 좀 아쉬운 점이 많아.

en: Nothing will come of his plans.
ko: 걔 계획은 아무 성과도 없을 거야.

en: He will get nowhere with his plans.
ko: 걔 계획으론 아무것도 안 될 거야.

en: His plans were regarded with some disfavor.
ko: 걔 계획은 반응이 좀 안 좋았어.

en: His plan was to start on Monday.
ko: 걔 원래 월요일에 시작하려고 했어.

en: His plan is to build a bridge over that river.
ko: 걔 계획은 저 강에 다리를 놓는 거래.

en: There is no choice but to agree to his plan.
ko: 걔 계획에 찬성할 수밖에 없어.

en: I agree to his plan.
ko: 난 걔 계획에 찬성해.

en: I agree with his plan.
ko: 난 걔 계획에 동의해.

en: His plan has both virtues and liabilities.
ko: 걔 계획은 장단점이 다 있어.

en: His plan will call for a lot of money.
ko: 걔 계획은 돈이 많이 들 거야.

en: His plan was put into action.
ko: 걔 계획이 실행됐어.

en: I referred to the company for his work record.
ko: 걔 경력 알아보려고 회사에 문의해 봤어.

en: I asked the company for his resume.
ko: 회사에 걔 이력서 달라고 했어.

en: His background parallels that of his predecessor.
ko: 걔 배경은 전임자랑 비슷해.

en: Admitting his lack of experience, I still think that he ought to do better.
ko: 걔가 경험이 없긴 하지만, 그래도 더 잘해야 한다고 봐.

en: You must make allowance for his inexperience.
ko: 걔가 경험이 없는 건 좀 감안해 줘야 해.

en: His experience qualifies him to do the job.
ko: 걔 경험이면 그 일 하기에 충분해.

en: Some board members questioned his ability to run the corporation.
ko: 이사회 몇 명은 걔 경영 능력에 의문을 가졌어.

en: His mobile phone produced radio emissions that interfered with other phones.
ko: 걔 핸드폰에서 전파가 나와서 다른 폰들을 방해했어.

en: His contract runs for one more year.
ko: 걔 계약 기간이 1년 더 남았어.

en: Both his brothers are teachers.
ko: 걔 형제들은 둘 다 선생님이야.

en: I know neither of his brothers.
ko: 난 걔 형제 둘 다 몰라.

en: He knows neither of his two brothers.
ko: 걔는 자기 형제 둘 다 모른대.

en: I don't know either of his brothers.
ko: 걔 형제 중에 아는 사람 없어.

en: His brother works for a trading company.
ko: 걔 형은 무역 회사 다녀.

en: His brother passed away last month.
ko: 걔 형 지난달에 돌아가셨어.

en: His older brother is two years older than I.
ko: 걔 형은 나보다 두 살 많아.

en: His brother was nasty to me.
ko: 걔 형이 나한테 못되게 굴었어.

en: His brother goes to school by bus.
ko: 걔 형은 버스 타고 학교 다녀.

en: His brother is a very capable doctor.
ko: 걔 형은 실력 좋은 의사야.

en: His brother dedicated his life to the activity.
ko: 걔 형은 그 활동에 평생을 바쳤어.

en: His brother has nothing but computers on his mind.
ko: 걔 형은 머릿속에 컴퓨터밖에 없어.

en: His brother is still taller.
ko: 걔 형이 여전히 더 커.

en: His brother is a famous soccer player.
ko: 걔 형 유명한 축구 선수야.

en: His brother is more patient than he is.
ko: 걔 형이 걔보다 참을성이 더 많아.

en: His brother came home soon after.
ko: 걔 형은 곧바로 집에 왔어.

en: There is a hole in his sock.
ko: 걔 양말에 구멍 났어.

en: His shoes are brown.
ko: 걔 신발 갈색이야.

en: His shoes are wearing thin.
ko: 걔 신발이 다 닳았어.

en: His shoes were so old that his toes were sticking out of them.
ko: 신발이 너무 낡아서 걔 발가락이 밖으로 다 보였어.

en: The mud clung to his shoes.
ko: 신발에 진흙이 잔뜩 묻었어.

en: Where does he work?
ko: 걔 어디서 일해?

en: He turned to a tall woman nearby.
ko: 걔는 옆에 있는 키 큰 여자 쪽으로 고개를 돌렸어.

en: His work merits the highest praise.
ko: 걔가 한 일은 진짜 칭찬받을 만해.

en: Such was his surprise that he could not say a word for some time.
ko: 걔가 너무 놀라서 한동안 아무 말도 못 했어.

en: His excitement is easily accountable.
ko: 걔가 왜 신났는지 충분히 이해가 가.

en: We thought his threat was only a joke.
ko: 우린 걔 협박이 그냥 농담인 줄 알았어.

en: His heart bounded with expectation.
ko: 걔는 기대감에 가슴이 두근거렸어.

en: I think his method of teaching cuts both ways.
ko: 그 사람 가르치는 방식은 장단점이 다 있는 것 같아.

en: His teaching method is both good and bad.
ko: 그 사람 가르치는 방식은 좋은 점도 있고 나쁜 점도 있어.

en: I think his method of teaching has good points and bad points.
ko: 그 사람 가르치는 방식은 장단점이 다 있는 것 같아.

en: He is mistaken in his ideas about education.
ko: 그 사람은 교육에 대해서 좀 잘못 생각하고 있어.

en: Neither of his students passed the exam.
ko: 그 사람 학생 둘 다 시험에 합격하지 못했어.

en: None of his students could solve the problem.
ko: 그 사람 학생들 중에 그 문제를 푼 애가 아무도 없어.

en: His lack of cooperation defeated our plan.
ko: 그 사람이 협조를 안 해줘서 우리 계획이 무산됐어.

en: His statement corresponded to what actually took place.
ko: 그 사람 말은 실제로 일어난 일이랑 딱 맞아떨어졌어.

en: I doubt the veracity of his statement.
ko: 그 사람 말이 사실인지 의심스러워.

en: I was dwarfed by his gigantic frame.
ko: 그 사람 덩치가 너무 커서 내가 정말 왜소해 보였어.

en: I wish I knew where he was!
ko: 그 사람이 어디 있는지 알면 좋을 텐데!

en: His salary is 250 thousand yen per month.
ko: 그 사람 월급은 한 달에 25만 엔이야.

en: His salary is 250,000 yen per month.
ko: 그 사람 월급은 한 달에 25만 엔이야.

en: He is well paid.
ko: 그 사람은 월급을 많이 받아.

en: His salary is double what it was seven years ago.
ko: 그 사람 월급이 7년 전보다 두 배나 올랐어.

en: His salary was increased by ten percent.
ko: 그 사람 월급이 10퍼센트 올랐어.

en: He won't get fat on his salary.
ko: 그 월급으로는 입에 풀칠하기도 힘들어.

en: His salary can't keep pace with inflation.
ko: 그 사람 월급은 물가 오르는 걸 못 따라가.

en: Because his salary is low, he can't buy that house.
ko: 월급이 적어서 그 사람은 저 집을 못 사.

en: His classmates laughed at him at once.
ko: 반 친구들이 동시에 그를 비웃었어.

en: His sudden illness deterred us from traveling.
ko: 그 사람이 갑자기 아파서 여행을 못 가게 됐어.

en: His villa on the hill commands the sea.
ko: 언덕 위에 있는 그 사람 별장에서는 바다가 훤히 보여.

en: His argument was aside from the point.
ko: 그 사람 주장은 핵심에서 벗어났어.

en: Though his argument was convincing, we did not side with him.
ko: 그 사람 주장이 설득력은 있었지만, 우린 그 사람 편을 안 들어줬어.

en: His argument was based on facts.
ko: 그 사람 주장은 사실에 근거한 거였어.

en: His argument is rational.
ko: 그 사람 주장은 합리적이야.

en: His argument is inconsistent with our policy.
ko: 그 사람 주장은 우리 방침이랑 안 맞아.

en: His argument was far from rational.
ko: 그 사람 주장은 전혀 합리적이지 않았어.

en: I find no logic in his argument.
ko: 그 사람 주장에는 도대체 논리가 없어.

en: His argument was most convincing.
ko: 그 사람 주장은 정말 설득력 있었어.

en: His skills qualified him for the job.
ko: 그 사람은 실력이 좋아서 그 일에 딱이었어.

en: His technique was unique and absolutely amazing.
ko: 그 사람 기술은 독특하고 정말 대단했어.

en: I admire his aristocratic manners.
ko: 그 사람의 기품 있는 매너가 정말 멋져 보여.

en: Nobody can break his record.
ko: 아무도 그 사람 기록을 못 깨.

en: His record will never be broken.
ko: 그 사람 기록은 절대 안 깨질 거야.

en: His competition record was the worst among the five.
ko: 다섯 명 중에서 그 사람 경기 기록이 제일 안 좋았어.

en: His record is a new world record in the 100-meter dash.
ko: 그 사람 기록은 100미터 달리기 세계 신기록이야.

en: His memory has been decaying because of age.
ko: 그 사람은 나이가 들어서 기억력이 예전 같지 않아.

en: His memory amazes me.
ko: 그 사람 기억력은 정말 놀라워.

en: His loss of memory is a psychological problem rather than a physical one.
ko: 그 사람 기억상실은 신체적인 것보다 심리적인 문제야.

en: His moods often change.
ko: 그 사람은 기분 변화가 심해.

en: His affected manner of speaking seemed very absurd to me.
ko: 그 사람의 가식적인 말투가 나한테는 정말 어처구니없게 들렸어.

en: He must be worked upon so that his feeling may be made to change.
ko: 그 사람 마음을 돌리려면 좀 공을 들여야 해.

en: We tried in vain to make him change his mind.
ko: 그 사람 마음을 돌리려고 애썼지만 소용없었어.

en: We tried to get him to change his mind, but couldn't.
ko: 그 사람 마음을 돌려보려고 했는데 안 되더라.

en: I think I hurt his feelings.
ko: 내가 그 사람 기분을 상하게 한 것 같아.

en: I can't understand his feeling.
ko: 그 사람 기분을 이해 못 하겠어.

en: I can't understand his feelings.
ko: 그 사람 마음을 도저히 이해 못 하겠어.

en: I calculate he will be late coming home.
ko: 내 생각엔 그 사람 집에 늦게 올 것 같아.

en: I wonder why he is late.
ko: 그 사람은 왜 이렇게 늦는 걸까?

en: I found it difficult to please him.
ko: 걔 비위 맞추기 진짜 힘들더라.

en: He is rarely in a good mood.
ko: 걔는 좀처럼 기분 좋은 적이 없어.
